titles.title: Zeroing Out Money for Buying Influence after Elections (ZOMBIE) Act
Zeroing Out Money for Buying Influence after Elections (ZOMBIE) Act

A bill to amend the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 to require each authorized committee or leadership PAC of a former candidate for election for Federal office to disburse all of the remaining funds of the committee or PAC after the election, and for other purposes.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Rules and Administration.

bill.summary:
Zeroing Out Money for Buying Influence after Elections (ZOMBIE) Act
This bill requires each authorized committee or leadership political action committee (PAC) of a candidate to disburse all unused funds within a specified time period beginning after an election or before the candidate registers as a lobbyist or foreign agent, unless the candidate files to run for office again before the disbursement period begins.
A committee or PAC disbursing unspent funds shall first pay any obligations incurred and, if funds are left over, it may disburse the funds in specified ways.
